alert.note: Alert for Little River; Miller (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 04 at 8:42PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Little River and Miller. Portions of northeast Texas, including the following county, Bowie. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Texarkana, Wake Village, Ashdown, New Boston, Nash, Hooks, Redwater, Maud, Red Lick, Wilton, Ogden, Richmond, Mandeville, Leary, Red Bank, Pine Prairie and Spring Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
